result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J. Runnerstrom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J. Runnerstrom was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No intoxicants, or controlled substances, no taverns; if prescribed medication take only as prescribed in dosage and manner prescribed

Supervision fees
Comply with family court orders
Comply with Social Services recommendations
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Runnerstrom

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:44 p.m. Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of revocation order, warrant and summary. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Jail - 90 days
Jail credit - 59 days credit
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:05 p.m.

03:53 p.m.Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm190 and 15cm246.  Defendant will proceed on own.  State moves to dismiss count 2 in case 15cm190 - Granted.  State moves to amend count 1 in case 15cm246 to Disorderly Conduct - 947.01(1) - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - CC
WHS/POP 1 yr
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
No intoxicants, or controlled substances, no taverns, if prescribed medication take only as prescribed in dosage and manner prescribed
DNA Sample
Comply with family court orders
Comply with Social Services recommendations
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given - The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Adjourned 04:02 p.m.

03:07 pm - Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states will proceed on own. Waiver/benfits of counsel free and voluntary.  Court enters not guilty please on behalf of defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

May not possess or consume alcoholic beverage in any amount, in any location, no taverns, cooperate with Dept. of Social Services, no unsupervised contact with any of his minor child unless supervised by Dept. of Social Service.

01:36 pm - Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
